metadata.title: CVE-2024-40964 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ALSA: hda: cs35l41: Possible null pointer dereference incs35l41_hda_unbind()The cs35l41_hda_unbind() function clears the hda_component entrymatching it's index and then dereferences the codec pointer held in thefirst element of the hda_component array, this is an issue when thedevice index was 0.Instead use the codec pointer stashed in the cs35l41_hda structure as itwill still be valid.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-40964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
